basics.name: Leonardo Meirelles
basics.summary: Passionate for quality, best practices, and effortless usability (for developers and end-users), problem-solving-oriented engineer with experience in UI/UX, continuous delivery and integration, micro-frontend and microservices architecture, and containers. Quickly adapt to changes in dynamic environments and requirements to provide the optimal solution.

publications.name: GitOps + Ferris Wheel
publications.summary: GitOps is a process of how to have your whole application (development, infrastructure, releases, deployments, and changelog) in BitBucket. It may sound too extreme, but developers and DevOps are using Bitbucket daily already. It takes advantage of existing tools to automate everything so that everyone can focus on what matters: new features and stability. Since we adopted the GitOps process, we are at 700+ releases, 0 downtime deployments, with rollback happening in minutes. The right people approve new releases without having to send emails or text messages. Most importantly, it keeps track of changes that allow quick troubleshooting by knowing when they happened.

publications.name: CI/CD at ADP: Going Global with GitOps
publications.summary: Leo Meirelles (Principal Software Engineer) discusses the continuous integration and development (CI/CD) process he implemented with his team.

highlights: Reverse-engineered an Adobe Flash application with XML/SOAP API and replaced it with a new web application with a small team under a tight deadline. Integrated cross-browsing tests using SauceLabs with the ADP's CI/CD framework using VPN reverse-proxies and side-car containers.

Building a proof-of-concept application to recognize payroll documents misdeliveries using images from PDF documents. It prevents security incidents for clients and employees; while allowing seamless integrations across multiple payroll services.
work.summary: Design and build full-stack applications; create, audit, and deploy containers. Improve security, advocate for automated tests, and optimize release workflow.

highlights: Lead the frontend engineer team on a multi-country payroll application. I provided guidance and direction to multiple co-workers in multiple geographic locations. Engaged in UI/UX reviews, prioritized features and, facilitated the development between teams. Enforced code standards, performed code reviews, and helped with unit tests. Built containers and implemented a CI/CD pipeline for deployments in 4 different environments.

Improved existing CI/CD pipeline using GitOps. Automated the approval process of releases, improved the deployment time (from 30 to 3 minutes), and optimized the build by updating only the necessary services (from 40 to 10 minutes).
work.summary: Lead UI/UX + DevOps engineers for an application to integrate multi-country payroll systems with human capital management.

highlights: Architected, designed, and integrated AngularJS 1.4 components for Cloud SQL inside Google Cloud Platform. Used Google Analytics to improve user experience by evaluating and prioritizing features.

Coordinated with Google Site Reliability Engineering, project manager, and backend API team to prioritize bugs, features, and releases using feature flags experiments. Built utility tools in Shell script, NodeJS, and Chrome Extensions for internal usage.
